page.title: 06Red Deer
page.content: The Exmoor stags cast their antlers every Spring. A good set of antlers can sometimes be picked up in rough combes or in the woods. One farmer has over several years found antlers always in the same spot near his farm, and from a distinctive malformation he has established that the same stag chooses the same spot every year to rid himself of the old head. On this same farm a hind comes regularly to a slope of bracken and hawthorns to have her calf. These two examples might help conservationists to keep a protective eye on the Red Deer.
